page.title: 15Cricket in Collingham
page.content: The{cricket club }was formed in 1849 on the Dale field in South Collingham and has 30 senior and 20 junior members.There are also 50 social members.Each player has to pay Â£18 per season.It is a very beautiful and well kept ground,the ideal setting for a village cricket club. The club has a{record of success,} winning many competitions.Last season, they were Nottinghamshire champion of champions,also winning the Newark Evening League cup with both the first and second teams winning their leagues.In 1982,the team appeared at Lords cricket ground for the final of the Whitbread village competition. The standard of play is such that ex county players are attracted to join, but there is also a policy whereby{ {Youngsters }of the village are encouraged,coaching being provided.
